page.title: 01LINTON AND ITS SURROUNDINGS
page.content: Linton,the focal point of this block is one of the largest villages in S.E Cambridgeshire and one of the most picturesque with many fine examples of timber and plaster dwellings. Historically it has Iron Age and Roman remains,a fine Twelfth Century church and a half-timbered Guildhall. Being the largest village in the area Linton has schools,shops and medical services which are also used by the nearby smaller villages.These services offer some employment as do the local farms and the light industries within the village.However Linton's rapid expansion during the past 15 years has resulted largely from its becoming a dormitory village serving particularly the cities of Cambridge and London. The arable farmland surrounding the village is amongst the most productive in the country including a vineyard.
